Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the extent of the highway closure and the threat of bullets flying across the border.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack sufficient evidence or support to confirm the closure of the highway due to bullets flying across the border.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the closure of the highway in El Paso was solely due to bullets flying across the border, without considering other possible reasons.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the closure of the highway, such as accidents or maintenance work, that are not mentioned in the claim.
